acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by William Polk in 1994. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1995.030 and 2018.026.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: In May 2012 newspaper clippings mostly related to Polk's death in Greek newspapers were assessed by conservation and determined unsalvagable due to mold. The clippings were deaccessioned.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Polk (1913-1948) was an American journalist for CBS who disappeared in Greece and was found dead a few days later on Sunday May 16, 1948, shot at point-blank range in the back of the head, and with hands and feet tied. Polk was covering the civil war in Greece between the right wing government and communists and had been critical of both sides. He alleged that a few officials in the Greek government had embezzled up to $250,000 in aid (or $2.2 million in 2007 dollars) from the Truman Administration, a charge that was never proved.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains: I. GWP writings - broadcasts and cables, diaries, notebooks, short stories, Middle East Mosaic (book ts.); II. Clippings, cables re GWP murder, clips collected by GWP; III. Family Correspondence, incl. WRP (William Roe Polk - brother), ARP (Adelaide Roe Polk - mother); IV. GWP memorabilia, awards, memorials; V. Photographs - GWP, WRP, other family.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Coyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by George Washington Polk was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
